tags: I'm in a big gendrya mood lately
I swear I'll get an actual art program when I have money
anyway yeah this scene kills me whenever I think about it
summary: As Arya was cinching her saddle girth, Gendry came up to say that he was sorry. She put a foot in the stirrup and swung up into...
caption:
As Arya was cinching her saddle girth, Gendry came up to say that he was sorry. She put a foot in the stirrup and swung up into her saddle, so she could look down on him instead of up. You could have made swords at Riverrun for my brother, she thought, but what she said was, “If you want to be some stupid outlaw knight and get hanged, why should I care? I’ll be at Riverrun, ransomed, with my brother.” (Arya VII, ASOS)

hey so do you guys remember that time Arya waited until she’d mounted her horse before telling Gendry off because she wanted to be taller than him?

because I do

I’ll be at Riverrun, ransomed, with my brother.” (Arya VII, ASOS)

because I do

summary: Only Gendry was different, the queen wanted him too. “I’ll tell you if you’ll tell me,” she said warily.“I would if I knew, Arry...
caption: Only Gendry was different, the queen wanted him too. “I’ll tell you if you’ll tell me,” she said warily.“I would if I knew, Arry … is that really what you’re called, or do you have some girl’s name?” […] “Arya.” She raised her eyes to his. “My name is Arya. Of House Stark.“

summary: Arya being trained by House of Black and White/Kindly Man always being told how she must be No One, forgetting her family and...
body: Arya being trained by House of Black and White/Kindly Man always being told how she must be No One, forgetting her family and Nymeria but the cook Umma immediately gives her a name, Stick. It’s one of those small things that made me emotional about Asoiaf and made me appreciate George, because Umma means mother and she doesn’t let Arya to be No One, Arya won’t forget her family okay she will come back home.

reblog.comment: Arya being trained by House of Black and White/Kindly Man always being told how she must be No One, forgetting her family and Nymeria but the cook Umma immediately gives her a name, Stick. tags: a reworking of that bizarre sister feud d&d shoved into s7
summary: The Game of Faces - Kallypso - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: The Game of Faces - Kallypso - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
For a moment, Sansa looks at the knife. For a moment, she believes Arya. But then…her wits return to her. She straightens and looks down at Arya.

“Liar.”

Arya smiles and Sansa knows she is right. Arya never wanted to be a lady. And she never truly hated Sansa. It is a relief to be sure of that.

tags: i just had to write this medicore thing
i am getting overwhelmed by arya feels
i am just here for arya
summary: The Mountain would come into the storehouse after he had broken his fast and pick one of the prisoners for questioning. The...
body:
ARYA VI Reread ( ACoK)

What scares me the most about Arya’s time with the Lannister soldiers is that how easily it could have been her who was picked up for questioning by the Mountain. And if that were to happen then she would have had no way to escape.

The Mountain would come into the storehouse after he had broken his fast and pick one of the prisoners for questioning. The village folk would never look at him. Maybe they thought that if they did not notice him, he would not notice them … but he saw them anyway and picked whom he liked. There was no place to hide, no tricks to play, no way to be safe.

For most of the Asoiaf series, Arya had managed to escape several sticky situations bc of her courage, her intelligence and her ability to act quickly. But imagine how much of a strong possibility there was for the Mountain to pick her for questioning. I mean out of her “pack” she was the one who had a sword and who had tried to fight back and even bite one of his men. It makes me shudder to even think about it. After all there really were no tricks to play and in Arya’s own words, she felt more like a lamb than anything else. There was a time when she was so mentally exhausted that she even began to think that bravery really didn’t matter.

What good did it do you to be brave? One of the women picked for questioning had tried to be brave, but she had died screaming like all the rest. There were no brave people on that march, only scared and hungry ones.

Arya Stark had always been brave. At the Trident, at that time when she knew that she had to let Nymeria go, before the queen, during her escape from the Red Keep, during her father’s execution, when she finally left KL and during her time on the road with Yoren. And thus it really hurts to see the kind of hopelessness she was forcibly pushed to by these men. She even had to learn to hold her tongue. The soldiers saw to that.

Their captors permitted no chatter. A broken lip taught Arya to hold her tongue. Others never learned at all. One boy of three would not stop calling for his father, so they smashed his face in with a spiked mace. Then the boy’s mother started screaming and Raff the Sweetling killed her as well.

It is purely my own opinion but I think during this time Arya might have developed certain suicidal tendencies. After all she was not only made to witness the merciless torture and death of her fellow companions but she also had to see how the women were raped by the soldiers. And yes I am using the term “rape” bc I am pretty sure that none of the women out there truly wanted to be physically intimate with those men. One of them eventually did lash out by hitting a soldier with a rock. She was of course publicly and brutally executed by the Mountain. It was during this time that Arya thought that it was good that Polliver had taken away Needle, otherwise she would have tried to run it through Sir Gregor.

Arya glanced sidelong at Needle, sheathed at the hip of a black-bearded, balding man-at-arms called Polliver. It’s good that they took it away, she thought. Otherwise she would have tried to stab Ser Gregor, and he would have cut her right in half, and the wolves would eat her too.

What gives me a pause here is the last few lines. Yes it’s true that Arya had always been one to abhor cruelty and protested against it. But in the last line, it seems like Arya knew that she was no match for the Mountain and that he could easily apprehend her and kill her. So it just feels very morbid that she would consider doing so even when she knew the harm it would cause her.

All in all, I just want to say that Arya Stark suffered a lot and yet somehow, despite everything she held on. She was strong, intelligent, cautious and very adaptive to her situations. I am just very happy that she was able to escape the Mountain and his men.

tags: a storm of swords arya iv

blog.name: kallypsowrites
blog.title: Kallypso Thoughts
blog.description: Welcome to the messy mind of an author, English teacher and maybe an adult. I post writing stuff sometimes. Mostly I reblog memes

summary: Some encouragement for the Game of Thrones fandom
title: Some encouragement for the Game of Thrones fandom
body:
Listen everyone, I know the game of thrones fandom has been crazy the last few days and there’s been a lot of some fans reaching across the aisle to argue on posts that clearly aren’t aimed at them. But I just want to say…you guys are doing great.

All you who are tagging your theories properly so that you can discuss them with like minded individuals while warning off people who don’t like your theories? You’re doing great.

All you who are putting effort into analyzing the tiniest details and facial expressions? You’re doing great.

All you who are reading theories by people you disagree with because you think its important to take in other views? You’re doing great.

All you who stay away from theories you know you hate for your own mental health because there’s nothing that says you HAVE to engage with every opinion? You’re doing great.

All you who love a character so fiercely that you would defend them to the end and are being careful to stay off posts of people who don’t agree? You’re doing great.

All you who are neutral on a character but let people gush to you about how much they love that character because they’re your friends? You’re doing great.

All those who are taking the time to have a calm discussion with those who don’t agree with your perspectives, trying to see their point of view without name calling? You’re doing great.

All those who step away from an argument when you know its getting too heated? You’re doing great.

All those of you who ship a thing and love that ship with all your heart? You’re doing great.

All those of you who avoid your NOTPs and let the fans enjoy them? You’re doing great.

All those of you who just love Game of Thrones and want to continue to write fanfiction, make fanart and create theories to fill in the long wait before season 8? You’re all so lovely and doing great.

Listen, its gonna be a long four months. I get it. But at the end of the day, we need to be kind to each other. If you love Daenerys and hate seeing hate against her? Block the tags, scroll past the posts etc. If you love Sansa and hate seeing hate against her? Same thing. If you hate a theory? Just keep scrolling. Don’t make yourself angry. Its not worth it.

If you’re part of the ship war, you don’t have to wage a battle on every post that disagrees with you. And if a post DOES make you angry, message a friend about it! Rage in a private chat with someone who wants to hear it and not on someone else’s post.

Because, we’re all doing this for fun right? This is fiction. This is a show we love. its fun. And there’s no need to wreck someone else’s fun. There’s no need to be right about everything. And there’s no need to purposefully make yourself angry, especially if its negatively effecting you.

So breathe in deep, practice self care, know its okay to step away. But remember you can still be just as passionate about your faves, theories and ships (so long as you tag them). There is a balance to walk. And to all the types of people I’ve mentioned above? You’re doing great.

reblog.comment:
Listen everyone, I know the game of thrones fandom has been crazy the last few days and there’s been a lot of some fans reaching across the aisle to argue on posts that clearly aren’t aimed at them. But I just want to say…you guys are doing great.

All you who are tagging your theories properly so that you can discuss them with like minded individuals while warning off people who don’t like your theories? You’re doing great.

All you who are putting effort into analyzing the tiniest details and facial expressions? You’re doing great.

All you who are reading theories by people you disagree with because you think its important to take in other views? You’re doing great.

All you who stay away from theories you know you hate for your own mental health because there’s nothing that says you HAVE to engage with every opinion? You’re doing great.

All you who love a character so fiercely that you would defend them to the end and are being careful to stay off posts of people who don’t agree? You’re doing great.

All you who are neutral on a character but let people gush to you about how much they love that character because they’re your friends? You’re doing great.

All those who are taking the time to have a calm discussion with those who don’t agree with your perspectives, trying to see their point of view without name calling? You’re doing great.

All those who step away from an argument when you know its getting too heated? You’re doing great.

All those of you who ship a thing and love that ship with all your heart? You’re doing great.

All those of you who avoid your NOTPs and let the fans enjoy them? You’re doing great.

All those of you who just love Game of Thrones and want to continue to write fanfiction, make fanart and create theories to fill in the long wait before season 8? You’re all so lovely and doing great.

Listen, its gonna be a long four months. I get it. But at the end of the day, we need to be kind to each other. If you love Daenerys and hate seeing hate against her? Block the tags, scroll past the posts etc. If you love Sansa and hate seeing hate against her? Same thing. If you hate a theory? Just keep scrolling. Don’t make yourself angry. Its not worth it.

If you’re part of the ship war, you don’t have to wage a battle on every post that disagrees with you. And if a post DOES make you angry, message a friend about it! Rage in a private chat with someone who wants to hear it and not on someone else’s post.

Because, we’re all doing this for fun right? This is fiction. This is a show we love. its fun. And there’s no need to wreck someone else’s fun. There’s no need to be right about everything. And there’s no need to purposefully make yourself angry, especially if its negatively effecting you.

So breathe in deep, practice self care, know its okay to step away. But remember you can still be just as passionate about your faves, theories and ships (so long as you tag them). There is a balance to walk. And to all the types of people I’ve mentioned above? You’re doing great.

blog.description: Side blog for all my Sansa/Catelyn/Elia love. Critical of show!Dany but still like book!Dany. Tully Loyalist. Pro Northern Independence. Book Jon >>> Show Jon. I track #courtesyismyarmor and #daughterofrivers

summary:
Sansa: Hold on! This is no time to be hysterical.
Jon: It’s the perfect time to be hysterical!
Rickon: Should we be...
body:
Sansa: Hold on! This is no time to be hysterical.

Jon: It’s the perfect time to be hysterical!

Rickon: Should we be hysterical?

Bran: No.

Arya: Yes!

Sansa: Maybe! But not right now!

summary: Arya: Security in this castle is a joke. Last year, I went to court with my spud gun in a duffel bag. I sat there all day, with...
body: Arya: Security in this castle is a joke. Last year, I went to court with my spud gun in a duffel bag. I sat there all day, with a rifle that shoots potatoes at sixty pounds per square inch. Can you imagine if I was deranged?

reblog.comment: Arya: Security in this castle is a joke. Last year, I went to court with my spud gun in a duffel bag. I sat there all day, with a rifle that shoots potatoes at sixty pounds per square inch. Can you imagine if I was deranged?

title: Home
body:
What about Jon introducing Dany to Arya? From @justwandering-neverlost

She held to the shadows of the balcony, allowing the darkness to hide her. It wasn’t that she was nervous to see him again, it was just…

So much had changed.

He was no longer the sullen man-child that had run to the Wall. She was no longer the girl who longed for nothing more than a sword in her hand and an enemy to skewer. And the woman who smelled of iron and flame was no longer what she once was either, if the rumors were to be believed.

Still, as she watched the reunion below, her worn heart gave a dangerous thump. He looked so much like Father. 

Sansa’s cool courtesies were pleasant, if expected. Jon had bent the knee. She was no longer an extant princess, just another Lady of Winterfell, preparing the castle and the North for the wars to come. She had done an admirable job, but now Jon had returned with the Dragon Queen firmly in tow.

He looked tired, the stern creases around his mouth and eyes much more pronounced than when he had been a boy– a boy that called her little sister and tousled her hair. And yet… He looked content, his eyes warm and calm, his stride sure and determined, but when he reached out to the Dragon Queen’s hand, Arya sputtered in surprise. She had never even seen him touch another woman outside of family, and yet here he was, tucking the Queen’s petite hand into the crook of his arm with a grace and ease that would have befuddled anyone who had known him before.

The Wall had made a man out of the boy she had known. The Wall, or else…

Her eyes settled on the Queen. She was as beautiful as they said, moonglow hair, violet eyes, royal bearing– no dragons that had been spotted yet, but Arya knew they couldn’t be far. A thrill lit through her blood at the thought. 

Dragons.

She would live to see dragons! Magic that had vanished from the world now mysteriously present once more, all thanks to the tiny woman below.

Sansa stepped aside and Jon swept toward the keep, his eyes automatically looking up to the balcony on which she hid, his gaze searching and finally lighting on her. She should have known she would never be able to hide from him, that their souls would recognize each other, at long last their wolf’s blood would call to the other.

A smile broke across his face, a true smile, one that he seemed to save only for her, and before she knew it, her feet were flying unbidden toward the stairs, pounding down the snow covered planks until even that distance was too great and she threw herself over the railing and into his waiting arms.

It took a moment for her to realize that the sound she was hearing was laughter– his and hers mingling together in perfect harmony. The toes of her boots barely scraped the snow below her, Jon’s arms wrapped around her as she burrowed her face into the furs at his neck, breathing in the particular scent of him– snow and sweat and something just so wholly Jon that it was difficult to pull away.

All too soon she heard Sansa clearing her throat behind her, the shuffling of feet as the rest of the procession had come to an abrupt halt, and Jon ruefully set her back on her feet, his gloved hands cupping her cheeks as he stared down at her in wonder.

“I never thought I’d see you again,” his gruff voice sounded in her ear as he crushed her to him again.

The lump in her throat wouldn’t allow her to answer, so instead she clung to him, her fingers scrabbling in his cloak.

A girl was Arya Stark of Winterfell, and now– she was truly home. 

All to soon he released her and stepped back, his hand reaching out to the Dragon Queen who took it with all the grace she could muster, the small smile upon her lips much more natural and at ease than she had been with Sansa just moments before.

“Arya, may I present Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryen?”

Arya offered a slight bow, the Queen’s lips quirking slightly as she nodded. “Daenerys,” his familiarity did not go unnoticed, and Arya raised an eyebrow in response, “this is my youngest sister, Arya Stark.”

Daenerys had the decency to blush as Jon pulled her closer to his side, his hands lingering a moment too long. Her violet eyes searched hers before she spoke. “I have heard much about you, Lady Arya. I look forward to knowing you better, and through my own experiences, rather than that of a beloved brother.”

“Aye.” Arya replied, her shrewd gaze snapping between Jon and the Queen. “I look forward to that too.”

First time writing an Arya POV– hopefully I did her justice! Thanks for the prompt JW! heart

“Aye.” Arya replied, her shrewd gaze snapping between Jon and the Queen. “I look forward to that too.”
